newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China to handle visa applications for HK.
newsitem.headline: China to handle visa applications for HK.

text.p: China's missions all over the world will start handling visa applications for entry into Hong Kong from June 23, the Hong Kong government said in a statement on Friday.
The Hong Kong Immigration Department, however, will continue to process and decide on the applications, a government spokesman said.

Hong Kong, a British colony for over 150 years, reverts to Chinese rule at midnight June 30. Under Sino-British treaties on Hong Kong's handover, it is promised autonomy on all matters, except in areas of defence and foreign affairs.
Foreigners from most countries enjoy visa-free entry into Hong Kong and the policy will continue after July 1, the government statement said.
